name: N-methyl-2-[2-(2-methylphenyl)-2-oxoethyl]-N-phenylbenzamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2481
Reason: 1,2-propanediol base, with a melting point around 50 degrees Celsius, based on the fact that 1,2-propanediol itself has a melting point around that value. The methoxyphenoxy group introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at +20 degrees Celsius. The methyl group reduces the melting point due to the reduced symmetry and molecular volume, estimated at -5 degrees Celsius. The phenyl group introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at +20 degrees Celsius. The methylene bridge introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at +5 degrees Celsius. The carbamate group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding, estimated at +10 degrees Celsius. The ether linkage reduces the melting point due to the reduced symmetry and molecular volume, estimated at -5 degrees Celsius. The effects are additive.
